alert.note: Alert for Coastal Martin; Coastal St. Lucie; Inland Martin; Inland St. Lucie (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 15 at 5:21PM EST by NWS Melbourne
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of St. Lucie and northern Martin Counties through 600 PM EST... At 521 PM EST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Tradition, or 7 miles southwest of Port Saint Lucie, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Port Saint Lucie, Walton, Fort Pierce, Stuart, and Saint Lucie Nuclear Power Plant. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Conditions are favorable for the development of weak, brief funnel clouds. These types of funnel clouds are harmless, but on rare occasions they can briefly touch down, producing wind gusts over 50 mph. If a funnel cloud is spotted move indoors and report your sighting to the National Weather Service. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or hard-topped vehicle. Remember, when thunder roars, go indoors!
